text: Vadavur Duraisami Iyengar (1880 - 1942) was a Tamil writer of detective fiction in the 1940s. He is one of the pioneer in detective story writing in Tamil language. His protagonist, Digambara Samiar, was a sanyasi or holy man on a mission to fight crime. Some of his works are made into movies such as Menaka (1935 film), Menaka (1955 film). In 1920 he started a journal called "Manoranjini". The aim of the journal was to propagate the importance of women's education. ==Works== His novels are *Purna cantirotayam Part-1,2,3,4,5 *Kumbakonam vakkil Part-1,2, *Maya Vinotha Parathesi Part-1,2,3, *Menaka Part-1,2, *Soundarya Kokilam Part-1,2,3, *Mathana kalyani Part-1,2,3, *Vidhyasagaram, *Vasantha Mallika. ==References== Category:Tamil-language writers Category:Tamil writers Category:Indian male novelists Category:1880 births Category:1942 deaths Category:20th-century Indian novelists Category:20th-century Indian male writers
